definition: to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
example/mirror/to view/reflection/to reflect/to inspect/to warn/(ancient bronze mirror)

sentences.english: Tunisia should learn from China's experiences in developing its country.
sentences.chinese: 中国的治国经验对突尼斯有很好的借鉴作用。

sentences.english: This study will help improve the management efficiency of Shiyang River, and provide a scientific reference to river basin water resource management.
sentences.chinese: 以期为石羊河流域水资源有效管理提供科学借鉴。

sentences.english: The Regulation sets an excellent example for our futural non- contractual conflicts legislation.
sentences.chinese: 《条例》为我国非合同之债法律选择立法提供了借鉴。

sentences.english: Berkeley took a leaf out of Newton's book by going instrumentalist.
sentences.chinese: 柏克莱借鉴了牛顿的工具主义。

sentences.english: It may be used for reference in developing new kind of steel and enhancing the elastic strength of autofrettage tubes.
sentences.chinese: 这对研制新钢材，提高自紧身管弹性强度等可供借鉴。

sentences.english: The fourth part of the thesis is of referring to traditional people-based thoughts to construct service-oriented government.
sentences.chinese: 借鉴传统民本思想构建服务型政府。

sentences.english: The third part mainly inquires into the significance of Neil L. Rudenstine's ideas of higher education.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分主要探讨了陆登庭高等教育思想的借鉴意义。

sentences.english: Fifthly, increasing cooperation with the international community and drawing on others? successful experience.
sentences.chinese: 五是密切同国际社会合作，重视借鉴国外经验。

sentences.english: Through research, we sum up practices and experiences cold-chain food logistics of developed country.
sentences.chinese: 发达国家在这方面有许多值得学习和借鉴的经验。

sentences.english: It's a habit you might want to consider in order to build up your own little storehouse of cash.
sentences.chinese: 你可以借鉴这个习惯，建立一个自己的小金库。

sentences.english: It should follow the example of the new Apex Theater in the mall outside of town.
sentences.chinese: 它应该借鉴城外商业街上新的Apex剧院的例子。

sentences.english: The achievements in this field give us a reference to apply fuzziology to other language-related disciplines.
sentences.chinese: 这为模糊语言学引入其他与语言相关领域提供了借鉴。

sentences.english: 'I thought that if I used my own culture, the Chinese culture, then I could advance quickly, ' she says.
sentences.chinese: 王陈彩霞想，如果借鉴中国文化，她就能飞快地进步。

sentences.english: His frontier policy thoughts provided the reference that was offered for managing Xinjiang in new China.
sentences.chinese: 他的边政思想，也为新中国治理新疆提供可资的借鉴。

sentences.english: Inner-party democracy building should absorb and use for reference the rational components of the contemporary western democracy.
sentences.chinese: 吸收和借鉴当代西方民主的合理的成分。

sentences.english: It has great significance of edification for the development and construction of boundary and drop-behind districts.
sentences.chinese: 对边穷后进地区的开发与建设很有启迪借鉴意义。

definition: practice/to put into practice/to live up to (a promise)/to carry out (a project)
to enlighten/to explain (a text etc)/to stimulate (a mental attitude)/enlightenment/revelation/motivation
to consult a reference/to refer to (another document)
innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails

in addition/moreover/(used before a disyllabic verb to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
lit. use others' strengths to make up for one's weak points (idiom from Mencius)/to use this in place of that/what you lose on the swings, you win on the roundabouts
